intro: Hieracium lansicum subsp. reboudianum, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. It has a taproot system and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in alpine flora studies.
